smell_analysis.justification: The diagram on Page 13, titled 'Autode register (Töötaja)', contains a diagram frame but is completely empty inside, lacking any classes or associations.

On the use case diagram 'Autode halduse funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Muuda)' (Page 3), the use case 'Unusta auto' is not connected to any actor and has no relationships (include/extend) with other use cases.
No use cases were found that describe the same activity with different names for the same actor.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package context.
The database schemas do not show redundant data storage (denormalization) across tables without appropriate Foreign Key connections.
All use cases follow a consistent naming convention, starting with an imperative verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9) are reachable through defined transitions.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4) are reachable from the start node.
Relationships on class and database diagrams include multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*') where appropriate.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 16) has 9 tables.
No class or table was found to have 6 or more visual connection lines to other elements on a single diagram.
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and the distance between related elements is not excessive.
All use cases and activity actions begin with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Riik' are all 4 characters or more).
Class names are consistently capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'isikukood').
No inappropriate Hungarian notation or type prefixes were found in element names.
